entries.title: Pope Francis Reaffirms Calls for Acceptance of Gay People
entries.description: The pontiff also reiterated his readiness to broker peace between Russia and Ukraine.

entries.title: Iran Grants Amnesty, Reduces Prison Sentences for Some Protesters
entries.description: The decision appears to reflect the government’s confidence that the worst of the protests is over.

entries.title: Ukraine War Makes Unexpected Winner of Turkey's Erdogan
entries.description: The Turkish president has leveraged his closeness with Putin to expand his international influence and shore up Turkey’s faltering economy.

entries.title: Russia Builds Pressure on Ukraine Along Front Line
entries.description: Russian forces are putting pressure on Ukraine along a growing portion of the front line, with attacks coming in the Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia regions in recent weeks, in addition to the fierce fighting around Bakhmut in the Donetsk region.

entries.title: More Russian Migrants Enter U.S. as Exceptions for Asylum Seekers Expand
entries.description: More Russian migrants are traveling through Mexico to seek asylum in the U.S., taking advantage of expanded exemptions to Title 42 border restrictions.

entries.title: Moscow, Tehran Advance Plans for Iranian-Designed Drone Facility in Russia
entries.description: Moscow and Tehran are moving ahead with plans to build a factory in Russia that could make at least 6,000 Iranian-designed drones for the Ukraine war, said officials from a country aligned with the U.S.

entries.title: Beijing Signals Desire to Move On From Balloon Incident
entries.description: Beijing criticized the U.S. move to shoot down a suspected surveillance balloon, though the initial response suggested it prefers to let the heat seep out of the controversy surrounding the inflatable craft.

entries.title: Pervez Musharraf, Ex-Pakistani Leader and Key U.S. Ally, Dies at 79
entries.description: Pervez Musharraf, the military ruler who emerged as a key U.S. ally in the wake of the September 11 attacks, has died, according to Pakistan’s military.
